alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 9:06PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Carbon and southwestern Albany Counties through 945 PM MDT... At 906 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arlington to 11 miles southwest of Bosler. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albany, Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Bosler, Brooklyn Lake, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Sugar Loaf Campground, Libby Creek Campground, Bow River Campground, Deep Creek Campground, Centennial, Nash Fork Campground, Lake Hattie Reservoir, North Fork Campground, Arlington and Woods Landing-Jelm. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 246 and 303. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
